topic: How to implement web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to implement web backends using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Implementing Web Backends Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive introduction to building web APIs using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI follows the PEP 343 standard for type hints
Provides automatic documentation in OpenAPI/Swagger format
Includes built-in support for routing, request and response objects, dependency injection, and more.
Integrates well with popular Python libraries like SQLAlchemy, Uvicorn, and Pytest
version_notes: Ensure you have updated all FastAPI dependencies (Starlette, Uvicorn) to compatible versions.
caveats: Python 3.12 is a new release and may still contain bugs. Test thoroughly before deploying in production.
While this guide focuses on FastAPI, it's important to learn the underlying principles of web development and APIs for best results.
